comments:
Description:
  Nest query with data set parameter binding will cause an error message.

Steps to reproduce:
  1.New a sampledb data source and dataset, and input ?select distinct CLASSICMODELS.CUSTOMERS.STATE from CLASSICMODELS.CUSTOMERS? in the Query of dataset.
  2.New another sampledb data source and dataset, and input ?select *from CLASSICMODELS.CUSTOMERS where CLASSICMODELS.CUSTOMERS.STATE=?? in the Query of dataset. Go to the parameters pane and set a default value ?CA? to the param1. 
  3. Drag the first dataset to the layout to get a 1*2 table.(refer to the attached design file)
  4. Drag the second dataset to the detail row and get a table nest table(inner table have its binding)
  5. Choose the inner table and go to the binding tab, click the button ?Dataset Parameter Binding?
  6. Set the param1 value: row._outer["STATE"]
  7. Save and preview it

Actual result:
   A error occurred:
Error0 : data.engine.UnexpectedError ( 19 time(s) )
detail : org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.core.DataException: Data engine operation failed due to an unexpected exception. Error evaluating Javascript expression. Script engine error: TypeError: Cannot read property "STATE" from null Script source: source, line: 0, text:row._outer["STATE"] at Created an attachment (id=39879)
The design file

The expression 'row._outer["STATE"]' cannot be evaluated because the expression of input parameter binding is based on "parent" rather than "nested" table.

When create data binding for input parameter, the "current table" should be the parent of the table in which the input parameter is defined. In this case, GUI should generate script 'row["STATE"]' rather than 'row._outer["STATE"]' as the script of input parameter binding.Reassign to GUI for UI changes.

The rule that expression builder should follow when define "bindings":
1.Data set parameter binding.
When make a parameter binding to a data set, expression builder will not allow a column binding defined in the very data set being referenced.This is because data set parameter is used to generate data set results, and before the data set results are available all references to its column bindings would not be evaluatable.Allow a data set parameter to be bound to its own data set column bindings will cause a a dilemma.

2.Data set column binding
Data set column binding can refer to column bindings defined in its parents, or itself, but not column bindings of its children.
*** Bug 141736 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 141711 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Show parent databinding in expresion dialog when set dataset pararmeter binding.

change the bingding expression as 'row["STATE"]' is verified 

but still has another error messange when review the report.

The phenomenon of this bug is fixed.

Another error doesn't rely on this one, so close it. And submit a new bug.

As Lin Zhu's comments, row["STATE"] has been instead of row._outer["STATE"] in this case.

Only GUI changed.

traces.message: Cannot read property "STATE" from null Script source: source, line: 0, text:row._outer["STATE"]
Cannot read property "STATE" from null Script source: source, line: 0, text:row._outer["STATE"]
Default value for input parameter cannot be null.
